docs.snippet: The viewing audience for the All-Star Game was up about 3 percent from last year, in part, presumably, because of Derek Jeter’s final appearance in the event as a player....
docs.lead_paragraph: The viewing audience for the All-Star Game was up about 3 percent from last year, in part, presumably, because of Derek Jeter’s final appearance in the event as a player.
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column holds that Derek Jeter's looming retirement helped increase MLB All-Star Game's viewership; notes that game drew average of 11.34 million viewers, up from almost 11 million for 2013 All-Star Game at Citi Field.

headline.main: Jeter’s Farewell Helps Reverse All-Star Game’s Ratings Slide
headline.print_headline: Jeter’s Farewell Helps Reverse All-Star Game’s Ratings Slide

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to a column by David Brooks.

docs.snippet: If Adam Wainwright did Derek Jeter a favor by giving him an easy pitch to hit in Jeter’s final All-Star Game appearance on Tuesday night, he has company, at least in folklore....
docs.lead_paragraph: If Adam Wainwright did Derek Jeter a favor by giving him an easy pitch to hit in Jeter’s final All-Star Game appearance on Tuesday night, he has company, at least in folklore.
docs.abstract: St Louis Cardinals pitcher Adam Wainwright told reporters he grooved pitch for New York Yankees shortstop Derek Jeter in his last All-Star Game, but later said he was joking; if Jeter did receive such a favor, it is not the first; in 1968, Mickey Mantle accepted offer from Denny McLain to throw an easy pitch, and in 1963 Don Drysdale supposedly tipped a pitch to his former teammate Duke Snider, who hit it out of the park.

headline.seo: Grooving a Pitch to Hit Has a Modest Home in Baseball
headline.main: For a Parting Gift, Do You Want a Grapefruit or a Meatball?
headline.print_headline: For a Parting Gift, Do You Want a Grapefruit or a Meatball?
